titles.title: Small Business Growth in Manufacturing Act of 2014

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow small employers a credit against income tax for the cost of on-the-job training expenses, to make the research credit permanent, and to increase the simplified research credit.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 4/10/2014--Introduced. Small Business Growth in Manufacturing Act of 2014 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) allow small business employers a business-related tax credit for up to 50% of qualified employee training expenses in a taxable year, (2) make permanent the tax credit for increasing research expenditures, and (3) increase the rate of the alternative simplified research tax credit.
